noun.description: A hope or ambition of achieving something.
examples: the yawning gulf between aspiration and reality
he had nothing tangible to back up his literary aspirations

noun.description: The action or process of drawing breath.
The action of pronouncing a sound with an exhalation of breath.

origin: Late Middle English (in aspiration (sense 3)): from Latin aspiratio(n-), from the verb aspirare (see aspire).
